result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J. Bast

records.addlTxt:
BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail. The matter is continued for scheduling conference on December 21, 2022 at 10:40 am. in Branch 1.  $2,500 recognizance bond previously furnished is continued by the court with all prior conditions. Defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
Scheduling conference on December 21, 2022 at 10:40 am.

Defendant Robert J. Bast not in court.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant failed to appear for the scheduling conference.  State requests warrant.  Warrant issued.

1:46 PM Defendant Robert J. Bast appeared by video.  Attorney Marconi DeFranco Barros appears in person for Anthony A. Lambrecht for State of Wisconsin.  Court has found the Defendant is ineligible for a public defender as well as a court appointed attorney.  Court goes over Defendant's rights.  Court finds that the Defendant is knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to an attorney.  Defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary examination without counsel.  It is his intention to to have the matter set for a pretrial/settlement conference so that he can discuss the case with the State and then determine if he needs to retain an attorney.  
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information has been filed.  Copy to be provided to Defendant.  Defendant does not wish to exercise his right to substitution of judge. 
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.  
Offer deadline:  August 12, 2022.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:51 PM Defendant Robert J. Bast in court.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant does not qualify for Public Defender or Court Appointed Counsel. 
The court finds good cause to toll time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order Appointing Counsel is denied because the person is not indigent.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 05-16-22 at 3:45 p.m.   Defendant given Petition for Appointment of Counsel paperwork.   
Minutes.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 04-25-22 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
RE:  Possess Fentanyl-2nd or subsequent offense, on 02-25-22.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess methamphetamine, possess Fentanyl and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-28-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety.    Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
